sections.title: Default vs Plan Mode
sections.content:
Claude Code operates in two main modes:

  • Default Mode: Immediate action on requests
  • Plan Mode: Creates a detailed plan before implementation

Use Plan Mode for complex features requiring multiple steps.
sections.example:
# Default mode
claude "Fix the failing test in test_models.py"

# Plan mode (when Claude detects complexity)
claude "Refactor our authentication system to use JWT"

sections.title: Image Analysis for UI Debugging
sections.content:
Claude can analyze screenshots to help debug UI issues. This is perfect for Django template problems or frontend integration.

macOS Screenshot: Ctrl+Shift+Cmd+4

Paste in iTerm2: Ctrl+V (not Cmd+V!)
sections.example:
# Take screenshot of UI issue
# Ctrl+Shift+Cmd+4, select area
# In Claude session:
# Ctrl+V to paste
claude "This button isn't aligning properly in my Django template"
